group.note0: Walk: 2.8km Yet more dental sutures, moving time 00:27
Short Los Altos Hills Moving: 00:45, Elapsed: 00:46 Up Loyola Corners Terrace Drive [1:04], up West Loyola - Eastbrook to Black Mailbox [4:41]

Skeggs standard loop of new Oljon Trail, then down to Giant Salamander, Resolution, Manzanita in both directions. Great as always. Good legs, just a bit chubby
Moving: 02:38, Elapsed: 02:49
Los Altos Hills and Rancho Loop Testing out the drone Moving: 01:10, Elapsed: 02:22 Up Loyola Corners Terrace Drive [1:00]
Rob Hunt's Big Sierra Azul, Almaden Quicksilver, Calero Adventure Moving: 04:19, Elapsed: 05:46 Up Kennedy Trail dip to summit [44:17], Almaden Quicksilver, then Calero. With a bit group.

Short Los Altos Hills Loop Moving: 00:45, Elapsed: 00:49 Up Loyola Corners Terrace Drive [0:49], up West Loyola - Eastbrook to Black Mailbox [4:55]
Uncle David passed away today

Los Altos Hills to Arastradero with Bob Foothill, Arastradero small loop, return to BO, then another loop towards Taffee. Bob pre-riding some routes for local MTB high school team rides. Moving: 02:24, Elapsed: 02:42 Up Arastradero Rd / Page Mill Junction to Stirrup Stop Sign [2:14], up Elena Climb -- Robleda to Taafe [1:04]
Moody Moving: 01:20, Elapsed: 01:21 Up Hilltop Drive [3:27], up Moody [6:20]
Fly to Toronto
Morning train to Montreal (Dorval) then visitation for Uncle David.
Uncle David burial ceremony
Fly from Dorval to SFO

Moving: 02:52, Elapsed: 03:00 Up Hilltop Drive [3:05], up Chaparral Dirt [6:13] ,Los Trancos poach, down Stevens Canyon. First ride in 9 days. Legs were great, but did get tired, as expected. 1 Banana Slug
Walk: 2.34km to Dentist and return.

Moving: 03:00, Elapsed: 03:44 Up Mt. Hamilton - Alum Rock to Observatory [114:09], up Mt Hamilton 1st Climb [36:40], up Mt Hamilton - Alum Rock to Miguelita Road [5:41], up Mt. Hamilton 2nd/Middle Climb - Parking to crest [20:34], up Mt. Hamilton 3rd Climb [50:03] Mt. Hamilton for some sunshine and return to base. Cloud cover from 800 to 1000 m, sunny up top. Legs were amazing, just need to work on not being so fat.

Calero Heaven w/ Rickey First time doing the full Calero experience. Truely amazing trail conditions. Legs a bit heavy today to start, but still a top 100 ride. Moving: 03:02, Elapsed: 03:18 Up Cottle Wall [4:39], up Calero to Rancho climb [20:26], up Chisnantuck to eastern point UH [11:07]

Moving: 04:18, Elapsed: 04:33 Almaden Quicksilver full CCW loop, then full Calero. Hard, non-stop effort, legs were good until 3:15, thereafter had more trouble on the steeper stuff, but still rode hard. Dirt heaven. 2 Bobcats, 41 Deer. Up Mine Hill Trail to Randol Trail [12:48], up Guadalupe Res to Water Trough [20:27], up Cottle Wall [4:36], up Calero to Rancho climb [20:20], up Chisnantuck to eastern point UH [10:52], up Mayfair Ranch climb [18:14], up Mayfair Climb to first gate [7:37], up Longwall @ RCDO [17:16].

AM: Dentist Sunset ride with Boris. Up Montebello to School [22:54], up Montebello [50:19], up Montebello to water wheel start [48:37], Black Mountain, Bella Vista, down Page Mill. Legs still tired from Monday, but otherwise a good medium ride. New Lake shoes and Candy pedals. Moving: 02:22, Elapsed: 02:28

Moving: 03:00, Elapsed: 05:06 Mission Peak loop. Up YSC trail 1st part [3:32], up Spring Valley Trail (gate to gate) [14:07], up Peak Trail to Outhouse [19:44], up Ohlone singletrack climb (Peak Trail) [7:22] 2 Coyotes, 1 Deer, Las Vegas Tacos

Moving: 02:32, Elapsed: 04:26 Mission Peak Again w/ Sasha Operation drone retrieval and Tacos Las Vegas. Up YSC trail 1st part [3:38], up Spring Valley Trail (gate to gate) [13:12], up Peak Trail to Outhouse [19:08], up Ohlone singletrack climb (Peak Trail) [7:04] Sling shot, fishing line and weight worked. Amazed my legs could handle mission peak gradients two days around.

Moving: 01:42, Elapsed: 01:46 Short Calero ride. Up Cottle Wall [4:55], up Calero to Rancho climb [19:36], up Chisnantuck to eastern point UH [10:23]. Colder weather today, and felt heavy in the chest, didn't want to push it.

Mission Peak and Taqueria Las Vegas loop Feeling a bit off still, but still managed to clean the climb. Moving: 02:19, Elapsed: 03:42 Up YSC trail 1st part [3:44], up Spring Valley Trail (gate to gate) [13:26], up Peak Trail to Outhouse [18:55], up Ohlone singletrack climb (Peak Trail) [7:16], up Ohlone - Y [11:22]

Grandpa Mark's Excellent 6h East Bay Dirt Exploratorium. First time EVER on any of these roads or trails. Great route. Legs were MIA to start, but endurance was fine after starting a sugar IV. With Mark, Dave T, Richard, Jim English, Bill H, Ken Moving: 05:19, Elapsed: 06:15 Up kom [13:09], up MacDonald trail, Bort Meadow to Parkridge [13:34], up Macdonald Trail [7:56], up Tunnel Road [20:37], up Sibley Climb [12:41]

Short Los Altos Loop Legs still tired from Saturday. Filed the glazing off my brake pads and mostly resolved my howling brake problem Moving: 00:46, Elapsed: 00:48 Up Loyola Corners Terrace Drive [1:03]
Walk: 6.21km Sunnyvale post-illness walk, moving time 01:14
Indian grocery Moving: 00:35, Elapsed: 01:14

Arastradero Preserve and return Arastradero loop and return. First ride after being sick this past week. Moving: 01:50, Elapsed: 02:43 Up Path - O'Keefe to Robleda including sweet start jump [2:50], up Arastradero Rd / Page Mill Junction to Stirrup Stop Sign [2:06]
Walk: 2.35km Final dentist walk, moving time 00:22

Grizzly Flat, Slate Creek, Tarwater Big Tree You gotta ride to ride. Legs still felt last week's illness, until Skyline. Then went for the Ward Road drop and was rewarded with a really nice ride. Definitely a stretch ride. 40 km dirt. Moving: 04:53, Elapsed: 06:15 Up Grizzly Flat [25:52], up Tarwater Big Tree Trail [19:26], up Camp Pomponio Rd. [14:45], up West Alpine - Camp Pomponi Road to Lookout Parking [23:33]
Rest day
38 residential turkeys Moving: 00:49, Elapsed: 00:51 Up Loyola Corners Terrace Drive [1:04]

Moving: 05:00, Elapsed: 05:59 Arastradero, up Alpine (Willowbrook to Joaquin) [15:58], up Dirt Alpine - Gate to Gate [26:28], up Dirt Alpine - Bottom Third [7:10], up Dirt Alpine - Middle Third [8:35], up Dirt Alpine - Top Third [10:35], White Oak, Stevens Canyon, up Grizzly Flat [24:32], Peters Creek, tree farm, up New White Oak Trail [11:55], Ancient Oak, up Hawk Ridge Trail [6:58], Ridge to Rapley Ranch, down Windy Hill, Arastradero. Joy's Menlo Velo + Stanford Mixie. Boris, Miles + Stanford Nick, Ben and Robin. 2 Banana Slugs + Flybys of Steven Woo, BMC and Terry Smurf. Good ride. All systems working, except for being a wee bit portly.

Moving: 03:00, Elapsed: 03:46 Mission Peak loop back to Taqueria Las Vegas. Up YSC trail 1st part [3:37], up Spring Valley Trail (gate to gate) [13:36], up Peak Trail to Outhouse [20:12], up Ohlone singletrack climb (Peak Trail) [7:22], up Ohlone - Y [12:26] Strong enough, but felt almost a teeny bit sick today. Better to stop and take lots of pictures when feeling like this. New BB did not take care of BB creak. Front brake still howling. Confused about these two issues.
One way to Los Altos Moving: 00:33, Elapsed: 01:18

Moving: 05:23, Elapsed: 06:29 Rob's Dirt Church at Almaden Quicksilver Up Virl O. Norton Trail to Hacienda [13:07], up Almaden Quicksilver, Mockingbird Climb [14:39], up Mine Hill climb - 2nd part [8:05], up Randol Res 2 Bench [23:10], up Calero Lisa Killough Part 1 [6:23], up Calero Lisa Killough Part 2 [6:36], up Calero Cottle and Chisnantuck [28:19], up Calero Chisnantuck Singletrack [19:11], up Calero Mayfair Ranch South [10:02], up Calero Longwall [17:35] then Santa Teresa w/ 1 Bobcat, 1 Joy Biff + 75 km Real Dirt™ With Dave T, Joy, Boris, RobH, Grandpa Mark and Ben. Slow and out of it for first hour, then felt okay. Really nice endurance ride with lots of bumps, but tedious survival pavement for last 9km. Needed to lube chain, thanks to MarkK for bringing lube! 300m was back to car from Rob Hunt's house

Moving: 03:09, Elapsed: 03:21 Start at Harry Road, up Calero Lisa Killough Part 1 [6:53], up Calero Lisa Killough Part 2 [6:37], up Calero Mayfair Ranch West [18:58], up Calero Longwall [17:52]. 13 Deer 7 Turkeys w/ Curtis Nice ride. Legs blocked up today.
Final dentist trip for crown Moving: 01:40, Elapsed: 02:27
moving time 03:34 Rent Specialized Levo eBike. Start at base of Mt. Eden, Charcoal Road, down Skyline to Sea and Saratoga Toll Road, up Kings Creek Truck Road, down JNT w/ 7 Turkeys, 15 Deer,
Lombardy region begins Covid-19 lock down.

Moving: 03:55, Elapsed: 05:06 eBike Levo SL Demo Ride Start at base of Mt. Eden, up Table Mountain Climb [16:48], up Charcoal Road [10:51], down Skyline to the Sea and Saratoga Toll Road, Michael's Summit Loop Trail, up Kings Creek Truck Road [16:29], down JNT, backside of Pierce and Mt. Eden. Italy begins country-wide Covid-19 lockdown.
Commute: Commute to Los Altos and return Moving: 01:05, Elapsed: 05:12

Moving: 06:23, Elapsed: 07:32 Huffmaster Hopper Preride w/ Jessie Started out not feeling on, then after getting warmed up felt even worse. Couldn't generate any power, could only spin. Even the triceps hurt. Really nice dirt roads, but too much bitumen. Nothing very steep.
Rest day
Rest day
Aborted ride in the cold, rain came in at just the wrong time. Moving: 00:10, Elapsed: 00:12
Slow leak, Fremont Older mud, Screw through tire puncture Legs were good. Went into Fremont Older until it was too muddy. Moving: 01:06, Elapsed: 01:21

Fremont Older Legs okay. Another nano slow leak, in the front this time. Moving: 01:32, Elapsed: 01:39 Up Coyote Ridge: the climb [to tree top] [15:05], up Fremont Older - 7 Springs to Cora Older [7:38]
Bay Area's first day of Covid-19 stay-at-home.

Stevens Canyon, Up New White Oak Trail [13:03], Los Trancos, home. Moving: 03:10, Elapsed: 03:35
1 Deer Tick, 1 Bunny Rabbit, 4 Turkeys, 5 Deer
California's first day of state-wide Covid-19 stay-at-home order.

Moving: 02:22, Elapsed: 02:30 Page Mill and return Lots of cars parked at Russian Ridge for hiking. Too many probably. Up Hilltop Drive [3:02], up Moody [6:17], up Page Mill - Moody to Montebello [29:49], up Page Mill - Bottom of Moody to 685m [41:11]. Legs have sucked for 4 out of the last 5 rides.

Moving: 02:39, Elapsed: 03:06 Start at Harry Road, up Calero Cottle and Chisnantuck [29:45], up Calero Chisnantuck Singletrack [20:05], down Catamount, up Calero Longwall [17:06]. Highball is da bomb. Perfect dirt. Legs sucked as usual until one hill was done, then it got more fun. Trails were only lightly used. Had tummy emergency on the trail at beginning of the ride.
Shelter in Place (SiP) Day 4

Moving: 02:43, Elapsed: 03:39 Start at Harry Road, up Calero Lisa Killough Part 1 [7:03], up Calero Lisa Killough Part 2 [6:37], up Calero Cottle and Chisnantuck [29:18], up Calero Chisnantuck Singletrack [19:57], down Catamount, up Calero Longwall [18:27] With Grandpa Mark and Bill Harkola. Sucked yet again, it's been a bad two weeks. SRAM rims can't hold air worth shit. But it was beautiful.

Moving: 02:07, Elapsed: 02:47 Calero. Up Calero Lisa Killough Part 1 [7:31], up Calero Lisa Killough Part 2 [6:32], up Cottle Wall [4:41], up Chisnantuck to eastern point UH [12:25]. 1 Freshened up tire setup with new rim tape and sealant, 2 CO2 Cartridges, 1 inner tube fubar, 1 tire fubar, 1 rim fubar, 1 pair glasses sprayed with sealant, 4 Fvcks, 3 Shits w/ 15 km Real Rim Riding Fvcking shitty SRAM rims. That's it, they are never to be ridden again. Later: found out these were not tubeless ready tires.

Moving: 04:12, Elapsed: 04:58 Social distancing with Bill and Gramps Fvck yah! Up Calero Lisa Killough Part 1 [6:48], up Calero Lisa Killough Part 2 [6:41], up Cottle LK junction to Cottle Rest Site [8:51], up Calero Cottle and Chisnantuck [27:40], up Cottle Wall [4:34], up Calero Chisnantuck Singletrack [18:47], up Calero Mayfair Ranch West [18:11], up Mayfair Climb to first gate [7:35], up Calero Longwall [16:49]

Moving: 02:49, Elapsed: 03:30 Mission Peak loop. Felt great. Lots of Russian poopies Up Mission Peak Ohlone College Wall [3:05], up Spring Valley Trail (gate to gate) [12:55], up Peak Trail to Outhouse [18:50], up Ohlone singletrack climb (Peak Trail) [7:16], up Mission Peak Fire Road [11:15]
Moving: 03:40, Elapsed: 04:01 Up Montebello to School [23:07], up Montebello to water wheel start [50:59], Russian Ridge w/ Sasha and Mia Föelsh Flybys Meh ride.

Moving: 03:17, Elapsed: 03:35 Up Calero Lisa Killough Part 1 [7:20], up Calero Lisa Killough Part 2 [7:05], up Cottle LK junction to Cottle Rest Site [10:01], up Calero Cottle and Chisnantuck [31:38], up Cottle Wall [4:52], up Calero Chisnantuck Singletrack [21:46], up Calero Mayfair Ranch West [18:12], up Mayfair Climb to first gate [7:50], up Calero Longwall [16:59] Fair legs. Okay ride.

Moving: 03:12, Elapsed: 03:22 Up Calero Lisa Killough Part 1 [7:09], up Calero Lisa Killough Part 2 [7:01], up Cottle LK junction to Cottle Rest Site [9:54], up Calero Cottle and Chisnantuck [30:01], up Cottle Wall [4:49], up Calero Chisnantuck Singletrack [20:07], up Calero Mayfair Ranch West [20:39], up Mayfair Climb to first gate [10:10], up Calero Longwall [17:17]. Beautiful ride. Legs were just okay. Bike was good.
Moving: 02:33, Elapsed: 03:35 Calero to top of Chisnantuck and return. Calero w/ Nancita, 1 Bobcat, 3 Turkey Vultures Nice ride with Da Boss.

Moving: 02:31, Elapsed: 02:52 Up Calero Lisa Killough Part 1 [7:09], up Calero Lisa Killough Part 2 [6:55], up Cottle LK junction to Cottle Rest Site [9:11], up Calero Cottle and Chisnantuck [27:55], up Cottle Wall [4:31], up Calero Chisnantuck Singletrack [18:44], up Calero Longwall [17:11] Good ride. Legs were working very well.
Moving: 01:20, Elapsed: 02:00 EBike: Peavine, Reno, Nevada First ride on new Levo. Nice trails, lots of fun. Rode with Nancy
Moving: 00:38, Elapsed: 01:37 EBike: Sunnyvale noodle ride Testing Levos
Moving: 01:46, Elapsed: 02:07 EBike: Calero w/ Gramps 4 Turkeys Levo is hitting it's speed max at just about 25km/h. Something not right.
Moving: 00:03, Elapsed: 00:13 EBike: Bike test riding on Ticonderoga.
Moving: 02:41, Elapsed: 03:38 EBike: Calero in eco mode with Nancita. Do the usual double loop. Levo 370Wh, me 318Wh.

Moving: 02:53, Elapsed: 03:35 EBike: Grant Ranch con Abuelito Mark Levo makes mincemeat of Grant Ranch. Beautiful ride on a warm day. - Battery consumed: 89% (623Wh) - Wh ride: 991.6Wh - Biker: 37.2% (368.6Wh) - Battery: 62.8% (623Wh)

Moving: 02:50, Elapsed: 04:06 EBike: Mission Peak con Nancita Día hermoso y verde. - Battery consumed: 62% (439Wh) - Wh ride: 770.6Wh - Biker: 43.0% (331.6Wh) - Battery: 57.0% (439Wh) - Maximum biker power: 495 Watt

Moving: 04:26, Elapsed: 05:12 EBike: Charcoal Road, Pescadero Creek, La Honda, Rapley Ranch, Stevens Canyon Start at base of Mt. Eden, Charcoal, Ward, Slate Creek, Pomponio, Brook Trail, Heritage Grove, La Honda to Rapley Ranch, Deck Climb, Couds Rest, White Oak, down Stevens Canyon. Really nice ride. Bike was awesome on White Oak and Stevens Canyon descent. 2 Banana slugs - Battery consumed: 91% (641Wh) - Wh ride: 1188.0Wh - Biker: 46.0% (547.0Wh) - Battery: 54.0% (641Wh) Up eBike Charcoal Road [10:56]

Moving: 02:47, Elapsed: 03:37 EBike: Calero with Nancita Easy ride. Still tired from Wednesday, so glad to have the eBike. BLEvo v3.6.9 Android - Battery consumed: 59% (415Wh) - Wh ride: 680.4Wh - Biker: 39.0% (265.4Wh) - Battery: 61.0% (415Wh) Up Lisa Killough Trail | CC | Climb Part 1 [6:19], up Flow DH [9:15], up Top of Bald Peak to bottom of Cottle [19:25]

Moving: 02:36, Elapsed: 03:08 EBike: Henry Coe w/ Grandpa Mark Only an eBike could make Henry Coe leisurely. - Battery consumed: 56% (399Wh) - Wh ride: 686.4Wh - Biker: 41.9% (287.4Wh) - Battery: 58.1% (399Wh)

Moving: 02:36, Elapsed: 03:19 EBike: Calero w/ Nancita Nice ride. Put in good eco efforts on all the climbs. 2 gopher snakes, 1 turkey, 1 bobcat bum. Up Lisa Killough Trail | CC | Climb Part 1 [5:04], up Flow DH [8:38], up Top of Bald Peak to bottom of Cottle [17:47]

Moving: 04:48, Elapsed: 05:14 EBike: Railroad tracks, Sanborn, JNT, Saratoga Gap, Sunny Jims, Hawk Trail, down Dirt Alpine, Arastradero, home. 7 turkeys, 3 deer, 2 Broken Cassette Teeth, 4 hours happy sit bones, 1 hour unhappy Sit bones w/ 62 km Real Dirt™ Bliss on a bike. - Battery consumed: 93% (655Wh) - Wh ride: 1182.4Wh - Biker: 44.6% (527.4Wh) - Battery: 55.4% (655Wh) Maximum biker power: 552 Watt Broke two teeth on XG-1175 cassette
Moving: 03:00, Elapsed: 03:58 EBike: Mother's Day Shred w/ Mama Nancita Grizzly Flat, Long Ridge, JNT.

Moving: 03:51, Elapsed: 04:17 EBike: Arastradero, Dirt Alpine, Russian Ridge, White Oak, Los Trancos. Wet with a bit of light rain. Wasn't really feeling it today, but still got the workout in. 1 Gopher Snake, 4 Deer. - Battery consumed: 75% (530Wh) - Average consumption per KM: 15.77 Wh/km - Percentage of average assistance: 26.1% - Wh ride: 987.9Wh - Biker: 46.3% (457.9Wh) - Battery: 53.7% (530Wh)
Moving: 00:26, Elapsed: 02:32 EBike: To Sunnyvale
Moving: 03:07, Elapsed: 03:45 EBike: Dirt Alpine and Russian Ridge with Nancita. It took a world champion to overtake Nancita going down Dirt Alpine

Moving: 01:32, Elapsed: 01:43 EBike: Dirt Alpine, White Oak, Black Mountain Started at Willowbrook, with 36% battery, finished with 4%. Legs were awesome, pushed the entire way for a fast ride. Gorgeous weather. - Battery consumed: 32% (226Wh) - Average consumption per KM: 19.03 Wh/km - Percentage of average assistance: 24.3% - Wh ride: 440.2Wh - Biker: 48.7% (214.2Wh) - Battery: 51.3% (226Wh) Maximum biker power: 555 Watt Maximum motor power: 442 Watt
Moving: 00:46, Elapsed: 00:47 EBike: Sunnyvale Noodle w/ Nancita

Moving: 01:33, Elapsed: 01:50 EBike: Rancho Cañada del Oro con Abuelito Mark Nice dirt today. Legs were fair, used more motor than usual. - Battery consumed: 44% (314Wh) - Average consumption per KM: 22.34 Wh/km - Wh ride: 525.0Wh - Biker: 40.2% (211.0Wh) - Battery: 59.8% (314Wh) Battery: - Start: 65% (454Wh) - End: 21% (140Wh) Average Biker Power: 194 Watt Maximum biker power: 520 Watt Up Flow DH [8:26], up Flow DH [8:09] Moving: 00:03, Elapsed: 00:03 EBike: Ticonderoga Levo Speed Test FIrmware updated on Levo, got speed set to 20mph (32km/h), plus wheel circumference changed from 2250 to 2000. Should get up to 36.3 km/h now.

Moving: 02:29, Elapsed: 03:13 EBike: Calero con Nancita Nice ride. 1 Grey Fox, 1 Unfortunate Gopher Snake Snake was across the trail in a bend, no avoiding it's belly. I hope I wasn't the first one to flatten it. But I know I wasn't the last. - Battery consumed: 53% (378Wh) - Average consumption per KM: 16.21 Wh/km - Percentage of average assistance: 26.8% - Wh ride: 669.6Wh - Biker: 43.6% (291.6Wh) - Battery: 56.4% (378Wh) Maximum biker power: 491 Watt Maximum motor power: 577 Watt
Up Lisa Killough Trail | CC | Climb Part 1 [4:58], up Flow DH [8:02], up Top of Bald Peak to bottom of Cottle [16:43]

Moving: 05:02, Elapsed: 06:13 EBike: Charcoal, Ward, Tarwater, Russian Ridge, Dirt Alpine Jah! Russian Ridge flowers were the best ever today. Great ride, tired at the end. Lots of hard work (630Wh ride). Saw 1 Turkey, got 1 tick, flyby of Kate Courtney (WC). - Battery consumed: 97% (680Wh) - Average consumption per KM: 14.07 Wh/km - Wh ride: 1312.9Wh - Biker: 48.2% (632.9Wh) - Battery: 51.8% (680Wh) Maximum biker power: 560 Watt Battery: - Start: 100% (700Wh) - End: 3% (20Wh) - Consumed: 97% (680Wh) - ECO: 83.6% (585Wh) - TRAIL: 10.8% (75Wh) - TURBO: 2.7% (18Wh) Up eBike Charcoal Road [13:02], up Camp Pomponio Road: Tarwater Trailhead to Alpine Rd. [7:33]

Moving: 02:09, Elapsed: 02:31 EBike: Dirt Alpine and Russian Ridge with Nancita for the flowers Short and easy 200Wh ride with Nancita to see the flowers on Russian Ridge before the heat wave. Fly by of WC, Wore new Smurf kit. - Battery consumed: 38% (262Wh) - Average consumption per KM: 16.49 Wh/km - Percentage of average assistance: 24.2% - Wh ride: 462.3Wh - Biker: 43.3% (200.3Wh) - Battery: 56.7% (262Wh)

Moving: 03:55, Elapsed: 04:32 EBike: 440Wh ride, start at Mt Eden, Stevens Canyon, up eBike Charcoal Road [13:14], Saratoga Gap, Peters Creek, Sunny Jim, Russian Ridge, Razorback, Arastradero, home. Got 1 Tick, saw 1 Garter Snake, 2 Bunny Rabbits, 14 Deer. Tired at end, used turbo take me home on the streets (which still takes lots of work, only it's faster). Needed lots of sleep afterward. - Battery from 542Wh to 24Wh (14.07 Wh/km) - Percentage of average assistance: 31.3% - Wh ride: 956.9Wh - Biker: 45.9% (438.9Wh) - Battery: 54.1% (518Wh) Maximum biker power: 493 Watt
Moving: 02:46, Elapsed: 03:46 EBike: Mellow Wilder ride con Nancita w/ 1 Biff + Dirtdrops flyby Fell on right quad while not looking at trail. Charlie horse was okay a few days later.

Moving: 04:08, Elapsed: 04:48 Up Hilltop Drive [3:45], Dirt Alpine, Meadow Trail, Russian Ridge (CCW), White Oak, Stevens Canyon First gravel leg-power ride in a month. Where's the power? Legs felt good, but it was hard going, in an okay way. 1 Rattlesnake, 1 Deer, 1 Unfortunate Thin Grey Snake Threshold HR 138, max 139.

Moving: 03:59, Elapsed: 05:10 EBike: Stevens Canyon, Black Mountain, Russian Ridge, Lost, Hamms Gulch. Nice ride. Roads and trails empty after 8pm due to curfew. Threshold HR 138, max 141 bpm. 1 SKUNK!!!, 2 Coyotes, 1 Gopher Snake, 3 Bunny Rabbits, 2 Hares, 3 Deer

Moving: 02:56, Elapsed: 03:44 EBike: Stevens Canyon, Black Mountain, Sunny Jim, White Oak 1 gopher snake, 1 turkey. Pleasant ride with Nancy, enjoying the beautiful weather. 300Wh biker energy. Did not put in much effort today, still tired from Wednesday. EBike: Ticonderoga test ride later

Moving: 04:45, Elapsed: 05:23 EBike: Start at Redwood Gulch. Stevens Canyon, up eGrizzly Flat [15:46], Peter's Creek, Ward, Slate Creek, Tarwater, Canyon Trail, Heritage Grove, La Honda, Rapley Ranch, Russian Ridge (CCW), Meadow Trail, White Oak, Stevens Canyon. - Wh ride: 1088Wh - Biker: 500Wh (1802kJ) - Battery: 588Wh Good ride. A bit tired in the middle, but put in some good power coming back from La Honda, with 300W and even 400W efforts. 1 Bobkitty, 2 Banana Slugs, 6 Deer, 1 Stick-broke-the-spoke, 1 Boris Flyby
Levo Maintenance: Replace broken spoke Replace 1180 cassette with XG-1175 under warranty Replace brake pads (worn 1.25 rear and 1.45 front) with SRAM Code Copper/steel.

Moving: 03:09, Elapsed: 03:46 EBike: Russian Ridge with Nancita + Tom Cooper flyby, 12 Turkey-Family, 4 Bunny Rabbits, 1 Thin Gray Snake Nice late day ride. Easy pace. Nancita loved Old Page Mill Road Trail. - Biker 313Wh - Motor 385Wh

Moving: 02:37, Elapsed: 03:06 EBike: Highway 1 Brewery, Chalks, Johansen, Butano Ridge, Highway 1 Brewery w/ Nancita. - Biker energy 323Wh (1163kJ) - Motor energy 371Wh Nice ride. Sunny at the coast, but cloudy inland.

Moving: 03:37, Elapsed: 04:28 EBike: Highway 1 brewery loop Chalks, Gazos Creek, China grade, Johansen, Gazos creek. Nice ride watching other people get tired. With Glenn, K-Money, Travis, Christine, Dave T, Ken (friend of Dave's). And beer-showing by Sasha and Winston. - biker 473Wh - motor 491Wh

Moving: 03:16, Elapsed: 04:30 EBike: Kennedy, Three Sisters, Woods, Barlow, Umunhum in the dry dust con Nancita Tough outing. Loose dirt everywhere. Midpen ploughing three sisters into soft dirt. Nancy hairpin biff. Lady honking at us on Hicks for existing. Dry air and lots of sun. Ear ache. Back ache. Lowest gear on both bikes not working well. Nancita's rear axle lose (discovered after ride). Jim startles the crap out of Nancy yelling SNAKE so she won't run over gopher snake. Super fatigued. Good effort on Kennedy with 20% assist. - biker 368Wh - motor 462Wh

Moving: 03:59, Elapsed: 04:19 EBike: JNT, Saratoga Gap, Peter's Creek, Skid road, Stevens Canyon Pleasant ride on a warm, beautiful day. - Motor 546Wh - Biker 460Wh Moving: 00:01, Elapsed: 00:16 EBike: Ticonderoga dropper seatpost test ride
Moving: 00:48, Elapsed: 01:49 EBike: Mountain View and return w/ Nancita Visit with Andre.
Walk: 3.54km Walking Sydney in Los Altos Hills, moving time 01:06

Moving: 05:24, Elapsed: 05:55 EBike: Start at base of Redwood Gulch, up eGrizzyFlat [16:42], down Ward and Slate Creek, Portola and Basin Trails, China Grade, Saratoga Toll Road, down Table Mountain. - Biker 557 Wh (2.3 Cooper's Sparkling Ales) - Battery 609 Wh - 13862 pedal strokes - Spent 11:34 above 135bpm, max 141bpm. - Power: 10s 426W; 30s 341W; 5m 219W Used 20% assist and did lots of work. Big quantities of dirt. 1 Big banana slug

Moving: 03:35, Elapsed: 04:14 EBike: EMT, Pogonip, 420, Mailboxes, Old Cabin, Bluffs w/ Nancita, Boris, Jason. Very pleasant ride. Liked ECO setting of 18 to 30%. Bike was awesome. Saw 2 Bambies, 1 Bunny Rabbit - Total Wh biker: 324.0 Wh - Total Wh motor: 289.7 Wh Power: Peak 542W; 30s 443W, 5m 208W. - 8679 pedal strokes Moving: 00:10, Elapsed: 00:10 EBike: La Cabaña Taqueria to Santa Cruz

Moving: 02:30, Elapsed: 02:47 EBike: Stevens Canyon, Russian Ridge, finish at Alpine Inn for beer with Nancita, Sasha and Glenn. Wasn't feeling it today. Happily used the motor. - Biker: 239.9Wh - Battery: 314Wh
Moving: 04:01, Elapsed: 05:25 EBike: Wilder solo, then with Nancita. Nice ride. - Biker 367Wh - Battery 402Wh Max HR 143bpm. 57s over 138bpm. Power: 439W 10s; 306W 30s
Swapped KMC x11e chain after 766km for PC-1130. Will wax KMC chain and put it back on.

Moving: 05:18, Elapsed: 06:10 EBike: Up eGrizzlyFlat [16:36], Ward, Slate Creek, Tarwater, Charquin, White Oak, Los Trancos, down Page Mill. Awesome ride, felt really good and put in strong efforts. Saw 12 incredibly adorable scampering turkey babies (Miss Tokyo snack sized), 12 turkey toddlers, 1 turkey mama, 1 Bambi, 2 deer, 1 bunny rabbit. Total Wh biker: 634.7 Wh Total Wh motor: 566.9 Wh 15203 pedal strokes. Eco motor assist very nicely tuned (18 to 30%). Along Stevens Creek Reservoir could just barely keep up with fast road rider. On Grizzly Flat averaged 224W and 137bpm with max of 143bpm. On West Alpine averaged 220W and 141bpm, with max of 146bpm. 37min over 138bpm. 38 min over 250W. Need to modify threshold to new value of 141bpm! Max power 489W. 20 Min max avg 209W.

Moving: 03:12, Elapsed: 03:52 EBike: Alt Trails of Fremont Older, Stevens Canyon w/ Nancita Not recovered from Wednesday, took it eEasy with 40% in Trail Mode. Total Wh biker: 303.8 Wh Total Wh motor: 395.9 Wh HR Max 141bpm, 23 seconds above 135bpm and only 2 min above 130bpm.
Moving: 00:41, Elapsed: 03:13 Murphy Avenue for Beer and Return

Moving: 03:20, Elapsed: 05:02 Stevens Canyon, White Oak, Dirt Alpine With Sasha and Alpine Inn stop, on gravel bike. Ride went well. Legs worked. Up New White Oak Trail [13:10], up Arastradero, Alpine to top. [5:17], up Arastradero Rd / Page Mill Junction to Stirrup Stop Sign [2:48]
Moving: 00:42, Elapsed: 05:56 Commute: Commute to Los Altos

Moving: 02:40, Elapsed: 04:07 EBike: Baylands and Alviso Nice ride out to the baylands, and the big Alviso loop for the first time, followed by tacos at Tia Juana. With Nancita. Flyby: Janet Gahagan. Power: biker 261.7 Wh; motor 256.4 Wh.

Moving: 03:20, Elapsed: 03:35 EBike: Richards Road, Whittemore, Borden Hatch, Methuselah, Manzanita, Alambique Nice ride with a pinch of new stuff. Used a bit more motor than usual. Start at Woodside, Richards Road, Whittemore, Borden Hatch, Star Hill, North Leaf, Methuselah, Giant Salamander, Crosscut, up Manzanita (Mark cleaned it!), Sierra Moreno, down Alambique to #84. 1 Banana Slug w/ Abuelito Mark. - Biker 340W - Battery 445Wh

Moving: 02:48, Elapsed: 03:27 EBike: Gazos Creek, Middle Ridge, Butano Fire Road, Olmo Fire Road, Candelabara Really awesome ride on a really awesome route. Middle Ridge con eAyuda es muy agradable. Olmo y Candelabra eran mucho divertido. Start at H1B, Gazos Creek to Ranger Station, Middle Ridge, Butano Fire Road, Olmo Fire Road, Candelabra, H1B. Biker 322Wh, battery 343Wh. Power 550W for 5s; 300W for 2m. HR 7 min between 135 and 139bpm, max 139bpm.
Moving: 00:37, Elapsed: 01:05 EBike: To Mountain View and return

Moving: 03:04, Elapsed: 03:27 EBike: Stevens Canyon, White Oak, Russian Ridge, Dirt Alpine Stevens Canyon, White Oak, Russian Ridge (CCW), Dirt Alpine, Arastradero. Fairly blah ride. Wasn't rolling too well, skillZ were off, glad for the motor. 1 Rattlesnake, 5 Turkeys, 1L Beer. Power: biker 348.1 Wh; motor: 368.9 Wh; 5s@530W; 30s@366W. HR: 6m43@135-140bpm
Moving: 00:31, Elapsed: 00:37 EBike: Los Altos to home Return from State of Mind pub to home

Moving: 04:01, Elapsed: 05:03 EBike: Aptos Creek Fire Road and Flow Trail Beautiful, awesome ride. Nancy did really well and was down to 5% battery. biker: 456.4 Wh; motor: 435.3 Wh Power: 30m@200W; 1h@181W HR 1m55 between 135 and 137bpm. Up Bottom of Tractor to Demo Parking Lot [21:26]

Moving: 02:03, Elapsed: 02:26 Arastradero and Return Felt mostly like crap and crawled. New chain and e13 cassette ran really well. SRAM rear wheel with new nano and rim strip still leaking some air. Up Hilltop Drive [3:34], up Arastradero Rd / Page Mill Junction to Stirrup Stop Sign [2:31]
Moving: 00:22, Elapsed: 00:25 EBike: Los altos flat loop Trail mode easy spin. Damn, eBikes are fun!

Moving: 00:04, Elapsed: 01:04 EBike: To Tim Oey's and Return
Moving: 04:01, Elapsed: 04:34 EBike: Stevens Canyon, White Oak, Russian Ridge, Los Trancos Stevens Canyon, White Oak, Russian Ridge, Los Trancos with a few extra new bits. Really fun ride, mostly in Trail mode. Good skillZ groove going by the end. 2 bunny rabbits, 7 turkeys. Biker: 441.2 Wh; Motor: 568.3 Wh

Moving: 03:11, Elapsed: 03:55 EBike: 2 banana slugs,. 1 Pacific red neck snake, 1 bunny rabbit con Nancita El Corte de Madera and Purisima Creeks with Nancita. Oljon, Blue Blossom, Crusscut, Giant Salamander, Methuselah, Star Hill Road, down Grabtown Gluch (really nice), Whittemore Gulch, Skyline, Skyline Trail (Kings Mountain to Molder Trail), Sierra Morena. Nice ride, but got overcast, then foggy in Purisima Creek, and was a wee bit cold along Skyline heading back. Power biker: 326.4 Wh; Motor: 306.2 Wh
Walk: 2.92km Afternoon Walk, moving time 00:46

Moving: 03:46, Elapsed: 04:32 EBike: 1 Coyote, 1 Masked Bobeeto, 1 Bunny Rabbit, 1 Garter Snake, 1 Deer , 0 Poaches Grizzly Flat, Long Ridge, Saratoga Gap, JNT, Fremont Older. Nice ride, went for using more motor today for fun. Felt pretty low energy and tired after stopping on Long Ridge, but better after Saratoga Gap. Max speed: 72 km/h. Power: biker 410.5 Wh; Motor 538.3 Wh; Biker Max 507W First oil on chain since waxing.
Moving: 03:39, Elapsed: 05:10 EBike: Arastradero, Windy Hill, Russian Ridge, White Oak, Stevens Canyon Nice ride
Moving: 00:08, Elapsed: 00:11 EBike: Bernardo Safeway to Home

Moving: 03:03, Elapsed: 03:45 EBike: Butano, gazos Creek, Chalks w/ Nancita Nice ride from Highway 1 Brewery along Butano Ridge, then down Olmo and Candelabra, then up Gazos Creek and down Chalks. Back much better today, though still somewhat spasmed. Power: Biker 357.9 Wh; Motor: 428.7 Wh

Moving: 04:31, Elapsed: 05:24 EBike: From home, up eGrizzlyFlat [17:13], Ward Road, Slate Creek, Tarwater, Russian Ridge, White Oak, Stevens Canyon, home. Pleasant ride on a hot day. Swam at Portola Redwoods swimming hole. Power: Biker: 495.0 Wh; Motor: 573.4 Wh; 476W@10s. HR: 3:50 @ 141+bpm; 37:00 @ 135-140bpm; Max 144bpm. 3 Deer, 2 Righteous Nanny-Hikers

Moving: 02:42, Elapsed: 03:18 EBike: Calero con Nancita Really nice ride in the only sunny microclimate on the day. Nice hard pack conditions and low 20's. Got into some good hill climbing rhythms in eco. Power: Biker max 495 Watt; Motor max 436 Watt; 60s @ 302W; 10s @ 420W Biker 295.8 Wh; Motor 304.3 Wh. 1 bobcat, 33 turkeys
Moving: 01:34, Elapsed: 01:37 Longer Los Altos hills Up Hilltop Drive [3:39]
Moving: 02:30, Elapsed: 02:32 EBike: Arastradero, Dirt Alpine, White Oak, Steven Canyon Levociraptor tryout. 58.7km. - Wh ride: 689.5Wh - Biker: 39.5% (272.5Wh) - Battery: 60.5% (417Wh)

Moving: 03:43, Elapsed: 04:42 EBike: Marin Headlands con Nancita Nice ride, not working too hard. Biker: 364.3 Wh, max 495W, 20s @ 420W, 1m @ 344W, 2m @ 300W; Motor: 426.8 Wh - ECO: 45.99 km (79.0%) - TRAIL: 11.73 km (20.1%)
Moving: 00:28, Elapsed: 00:48 EBike: eErrands I would have taken the car if not for an e-bike

Moving: 04:22, Elapsed: 05:05 EBike: 1 unfortunate garter snake (sorry) Grizzly Flat, Slate Creek, Tarwater, Dirt Alpine, Arastradero Biker: 501.3 Wh; Motor: 563.8 Wh. Avg 161W. 30m @ 194W. Good ride on a hot day. Swam at Portola Redwood. Even hotter from Portola Valley to home. Up Camp Pomponio Road: Tarwater Trailhead to Alpine Rd. [6:41]
Retire SRAM PG-1130 chain after 1394 km.
Tilers arrive to begin working on two showers at 820 Ticonderoga Drive.

Moving: 02:59, Elapsed: 03:55 EBike: 1 Whale, 1 Bunny Rabbit Sweeny, Planet of the Apes, Milagra w/ Nancita. Biker 258 Wh, Motor 324 Wh. Really nice ride. Avoided the smoke from the new fires around the Bay Area.

Moving: 02:39, Elapsed: 03:22 EBike: 1 Firestone Milk Stout w/ Abuelito Mark Sweeny Ridge, Planet of the Apes, Colma Road, Mile, Boy Scout, Milagra Biker: 233.7 Wh, Motor: 358.6 Wh Found a small Advil-assisted window to ride in, combating bad ear infection and headaches. Nice ride with Mark. Used Trial Mode a fair bit.
Moving: 03:10, Elapsed: 03:57 EBike: 4 Bunny Rabbits Sweeney, Pedro Point, Montara Peak, Boy Scout, Sweeney. Finding clean air during fires. Biker: 266.2 Wh, Motor: 371.1 Wh

Moving: 02:40, Elapsed: 03:52 EBike: Sweeney, Planet of the Apes, Pedro Point, Milagra w/ Nancita Really nice ride. Wintery weather, avoiding smoke from the fires. Biker: 252.2 Wh; Motor: 356.1 Wh. 10s @ 490W
Moving: 00:29, Elapsed: 01:19 EBike: Home depot in the smoky air.

Moving: 03:46, Elapsed: 04:35 EBike: Aptos Creek Fire Road w/ B-man and special guest The Great BOBEETO Biker: 334.1 Wh; Motor: 418.5 Wh Did Aptos Creek with 12% assist, then didn't worry about it so much. A little foggy from ear and eye infections, but still a good ride once I got a rythm going. Paraffin wax worn off during today's ride.
First application of Wendwax to KMC x11e chain, after 262 km of paraffin. Chain now has 766 + 262 = 1028 km.

Moving: 02:43, Elapsed: 03:24 EBike: Sweeney, Pedro Point, Planet of the Apes, Sweeney Escaping the smoke in Pacifica with Nancita. 3 Bunny Rabbits. Needed the exercise. Felt okay. Biker 300Wh; 30s @ 402W; 20s @ 452W; 10s @ 477W

Moving: 03:52, Elapsed: 06:13 EBike: Arastradero, Dirt Alpine, White Oak, Russian Ridge, Alpine Inn, Arastradero= 1 Hare, 1 Deer, 1 Sunset, 2 Pitchers Weiszen, 1 Adorable Russian, 1 Macho Berliner Nice ride. First Russian Ridge sunset in ages. 400Wh.
Moving: 00:30, Elapsed: 01:23 EBike: Fibbars and return
Moving: 02:07, Elapsed: 02:46 EBike: Up Black Mountain trail and return, after sunset on a warm evening. Saw 2 Mountain Lions just when starting to come back down. 238Wh
Moving: 00:28, Elapsed: 00:43 EBike: Home Depot and return
Moving: 00:46, Elapsed: 00:47 2 bunny rabbits, 2 deer Short Los Altos Hills loop. Up Loyola Corners Terrace Drive [1:05]

Moving: 01:58, Elapsed: 02:36 EBike: First ride in a week, and let the motor do more work than usual, to keep the lungs from overextending with moderate air quality. Rider 154 Wh, motor 282 Wh. Pedro Point, Old Colmo Road (full length), Planet of the Apes (S to N), Boy Scout with Grandpa Mark.
Moving: 02:48, Elapsed: 04:51 EBike: Arastradero, Russian Ridge, Alpine Inn. Nice clean air ride. Energy biker 269 Wh, motor 320 Wh.

Moving: 02:31, Elapsed: 02:50 EBike: Arastradero, Dirt Alpine, White Oak, Stevens Canyon, home. 1 baby rattlesnake, six deer, one bunny rabbit. Energy rider 300 Wh, motor 400Wh. Feeling a bit tired today.

Moving: 04:54, Elapsed: 06:00 EBike: 2 Bunny Rabbits, 1 Rattle Snake (on road), 4 Deer Start Mt. Eden, up eGrizzlyFlat and Peter's Creek with Nancita, then solo Ward, Slate Creek, Old Haul, Tarwater, Russian Ridge, White Oak, down Stevens Canyon and home. Bloody awesome ride. Did huge work, kept it in eco 20% almost always. Put lots of power down. Biker: 537.6 Wh; Motor: 523.7 Wh; 20 min @ 200W. Up Camp Pomponio Road: Tarwater Trailhead to Alpine Rd. [8:38]

Moving: 02:57, Elapsed: 03:33 EBike: Stevens Canyon, Russian Ridge, down Page Mill Biker 364Wh, pretty tired today, happy to have mucha ayuda. New rear brake pad before today's ride. 1 baby gopher snake, 1 Bunny rabbit, 2 big bucks, 2 deer, 1 big fluffy mammalian tail, 1 sunset

Moving: 02:41, Elapsed: 03:46 EBike: UCSC, Wilder with Nancita Start downtown, Pogonip, D Cup, Mailbox, etc. Pleasant ride escaping mid 30's weather in Sunnyvale for 18 and chilly to mid 20s on the coast. New chain before today's ride. Biker 227 Wh.

Moving: 00:05, Elapsed: 00:18 EBike: Morning Activity
Moving: 00:03, Elapsed: 00:05 EBike: Afternoon Activity
Prepare four more pallets for move. Really good energy getting house ready all this week.
Pallets removed at 9am.

Over 10 cubic yard of garbage including king mattress removed.
820 Ticonderoga Drive photographed in 3D today.
First night sleeping at 24 Coronado Avenue (Granny flat), Los Altos.

Moving: 03:03, Elapsed: 03:52 EBike: Dirt Alpine, Russian Ridge w/ Nancita + Darrell & Joy flybys + 2 bee stings Start at 24 Coronado Avenue, Lost Altos. Arastradero, Dirt Alpine, Russian Ridge (CCW), Ridge Trail, Crazy Petes, Dirt Alpine. Feeling a bit tired towards end of ride.
Tired and dragging from ride
Tired again, but not as much as Monday.
Feeling better again.
U-Box pickup of 9 cubic yards (7 cubic metres) of container contents.
First day of showing 820 Ticonderoga Drive
Moving: 01:36, Elapsed: 01:44 Arastradero trails con Nancita, from 24 Coronada Avenue, Los Altos. First ride in a week. After sleeping 11h, and then I needed a nap after the ride. But it was nice!
Moving: 01:01, Elapsed: 05:09 EBike: Los Altos, Mountain View, Sunnyvale triangle Visit with Andre, and maintenance on 820 Ticonderoga. Biker energy: 84 Wh; max 345 W

Moving: 04:20, Elapsed: 06:08 EBike: Dirt Alpine, Long Ridge, JNT, RR Tracks Los Altos, Arastradero, Dirt Alpine. White Oak, Peter's Creek, Long Ridge, JNT, RR Tracks, Ticonderoga, Los Altos. 475 Wh. 1 Chipmunk, 8 Turkeys. Aimed to to a big, slow ride down Ward, however switched from Eco to Trail after Peter's Creek and came home thankful for eAssist. Was seeing spots on Long Ridge and needed to back off. Diet including too much fat, is the likely reason. Biker energy: 474 Wh; max 430 W
Moving: 02:54, Elapsed: 03:09 EBike: Arastradero, Windy Hill, Russian Ridge, Dirt Alpine Fun, brisk ride in Trail Mode. 1 Bunny Rabbit. Biker energy: 326 Wh; max 534 W
Moving: 03:06, Elapsed: 04:36 EBike: Dirt Alpine and Stevens Canyon w/ Nancita, Miles and Boris, with Ron flyby Biker energy: 314 Wh; max 492 W

Moving: 05:00, Elapsed: 06:15 EBike: Marin Headlands, GG Bridge, Hawk Hill, Mt Tam BF ride today, 540 Wh of work (motor about 600Wh). Marin GG Bridge, Hawk Hill and usual routes to Mt Tam and return. 6 Bunny rabbits, 7 turkeys Biker energy: 547 Wh; max 508 W
Moving: 01:29, Elapsed: 03:00 EBike: Botanic Organic deliveries in Mountain View and Los Altos Lots of riding on only 3% Garmin battery remaining. Biker energy: 161 Wh; max 437 W
Moving: 02:25, Elapsed: 06:33 EBike: El Taco de Oro and Baylands with Nancita Old house, El Taco de Oro and Baylands with Nancita Biker energy: 79 Wh; max 502 W

Moving: 03:43, Elapsed: 04:18 EBike: Skeggs, La Honda Open Space, Lost, Razorback Ride usual loop at Skeggs, starting with Nancita, but she bailed. Then Allen Road and raided La Honda Creek Open Space's special dog trails, then got Lost and Razorbacked, Arastradero, Los Altos. Good ride with good skillZ. Biker energy: 340 Wh; max 506 W

Moving: 05:25, Elapsed: 06:29 EBike: Peninsula Hopper w/ Gravel Lovers Great ride on a cool, windy day. With Rob Hunt, Dave T, Boris, Marco, Miles, Travis, Christine, others (10 total). Power: biker 660 Wh; battery 623 Wh; max 652 W; 2s @ 611W; 5s @ 520W; 30s @ 400W Biker energy: 667 Wh; max 652 W

Moving: 02:05, Elapsed: 02:45 EBike: Los Trancos, Black Mountain, Page Mill First eRide up Los Trancos, used Trail mode today and was somewhat lazy and tired from Sunday. Cold with that hazy cloud cover that I am least fond of. Biker energy: 251 Wh; max 475 W
Moving: 02:56, Elapsed: 05:47 EBike: Dirt Alpine, White Oak, Stevens Canyon w/Nancita Low energy again today, used the motor. Biker energy: 294 Wh; max 507 W
Moving: 01:17, Elapsed: 01:32 Baylands mit Boris

Moving: 02:07, Elapsed: 02:25 Arastradero, Paved Alpine Out finding the push bike legs. It was getting too cold to go any further. Up Arastradero, Alpine to top. [5:02], up Arastradero Rd / Page Mill Junction to Stirrup Stop Sign [2:49]

Moving: 03:40, Elapsed: 03:59 Arastradero, Dirt Alpine, Russian Ridge Nice ride with the push bike. It pushed me backwards until I had one hill under my legs, then things were better. Good to do this. Perfect dirt, with recent rain. Up Alpine (Willowbrook to Joaquin) [16:37], up Dirt Alpine - Bottom Third [9:17], up Dirt Alpine - Middle Third [10:14], up Meadow Trail Climb [7:27], up Arastradero, Alpine to top. [4:46], up Arastradero Rd / Page Mill Junction to Stirrup Stop Sign [2:44]

Moving: 01:37, Elapsed: 02:00 Arastradero loop Nice leg wakeup ride in Arastradero. Up Arastradero Rd / Page Mill Junction to Stirrup Stop Sign [2:22]
Closing date for selling 820 Ticonderoga Drive

Moving: 03:22, Elapsed: 03:32 Dirt Alpine mit Boris Lovely social ride with Boris. Good legs for first time since the ebike days Up Short Shoot Meadowlark Trail - Uphill [0:51], up Alpine (Willowbrook to Joaquin) [16:55], up Dirt Alpine - Bottom Third [8:41], up Dirt Alpine - Gate to Gate [30:14], up Dirt Alpine - Middle Third [10:52], up Dirt Alpine - Top Third [11:46], up Arastradero, Alpine to top. [4:54], up Arastradero Rd / Page Mill Junction to Stirrup Stop Sign [2:45]

Moving: 03:26, Elapsed: 03:57 Arastradero, Windy Hill, Russian Ridge, Dirt Alpine, Lake and Sunrise Trail Start in Los Altos, short bit of Arastradero, up Windy Hill (almost cleaned it), Russian Ridge CCW, Meadow (cleaned it), down Dirt Alpine, Lake Trail, Sunrise Trail (new find thanks to Boris), short Arastradero, back to Los Altos. Nice ride, felt good. Leg power coming back well. Up Windy Hill Fireroad [23:29], up Deck Climb [11:42], up Arastradero, Alpine to top. [5:01], up Arastradero Rd / Page Mill Junction to Stirrup Stop Sign [2:16]
Moving: 00:31, Elapsed: 00:39 Los Altos to Santa Clara Brisk road ride that didn't suck. Picking up Bob from his back injection at Kaiser.

Moving: 02:01, Elapsed: 02:03 Alpine and Lake Trail loop Los Altos, Arastradero short, Alpine Road to Lake Trail, then return. Start with Boris, but legs weren't great today. Up Short Shoot Meadowlark Trail - Uphill [1:12], up Arastradero, Alpine to top. [4:43], up Arastradero Rd / Page Mill Junction to Stirrup Stop Sign [2:31]

Moving: 01:38, Elapsed: 01:50 Palo Alto Baylands mit Boris Pleasant loop out by the bay, with just a little bit too much effort keeping up with Boris (bad leg day again). Boris said AQI was over 100. Oops.

Moving: 03:28, Elapsed: 04:12 Dirt Alpine, Russian Ridge Arastradero, Dirt Alpine, Russian Ridge, Dirt Alpine. Nice ride in beautiful sunshine. Legs were good today, after taking it at the right spin level until warmed up. Cleaned the bypass and down Meadow. Up Alpine (Willowbrook to Joaquin) [15:28], up Dirt Alpine - Bottom Third [8:01], up Dirt Alpine - Middle Third [9:10], up Meadow Trail Climb [5:58], up Arastradero, Alpine to top. [4:09], up Arastradero Rd / Page Mill Junction to Stirrup Stop Sign [2:25]
Load container for Costa Rica.

Moving: 02:33, Elapsed: 02:55 12 Plump Turkeys, 5 Deer Excellent ride, followed the rules of not pushing beyond what I felt, then felt good after Chisnantuck climb, and pushed. Gu rocks. Up Calero Lisa Killough Part 1 [7:37], up Calero Lisa Killough Part 2 [7:22], up Calero Cottle and Chisnantuck [32:04], up Calero Chisnantuck Singletrack [21:49]. Air quality got to almost 100 as smog rolled in.
COVID test negative

Nancita COVID test negative.
Move up to Kit's place in Los Altos Hills, at 27800 Central Avenue.
Hike: 3.24km Afternoon Hike at Byrne Preserve with Nancita. Moving time 00:44

Sell Sanchez (Ford Ranger) for $1000.
Beer with Nancita, Boris and Sasha at Alpine Inn.
Sell Prius for $11800.
Moving: 00:58, Elapsed: 01:21 9 Deer Quick Arastradero loop from Kit's place along Central. Some mud finally.
Last night staying at 27800 Central Avenue, Los Altos Hills (Kit Gordon's house).
Fly to San Jose. Stay at Louisiana Hotel in Santa Ana.
Drive to Uvita, stay at Ken and Eve's place next to Heather and Derek.
Moving: 01:29, Elapsed: 02:08 Uvita a Ojochal Up Ojochal Calle del Puente [14:05]
First night at our Ojochal house

Moving: 01:31, Elapsed: 02:37 Last day of the year, first relax day in paradise Finally a relax day for just living. Nice big Ojochal loop + Pancito Café social stop meeting Erica and Scott before they head back to Ontario. Up Ojochal- Playa Ventanas [15:33], up Ojochal Calle del Puente [12:09]

Moving: 01:14, Elapsed: 02:50 Vuelta Perezoso Pleasant end of day ride. Costa Rica cycling lesson #1: don't leave your helmet on the ground where the piss ants can invade it, especially in the dark Up Ojochal Calle del Puente [14:11]

group.note: Sick with minor sore throat this week.
Legs generally sucked this week. Poor energy with lots of 9-10 hour sleeps at night.
Buy new 2020 Levo eBikes for Nancy and Jim.
Tuesday: Swapped KMC x11e chain after 766km for PC-1130. Will wax KMC chain and put it back on. Wednesday: Really good ride with Levo.
Sunday waxed chains and put PC-1130 chain back on after initial 333km using factory lube.
PG-1130 chain now has 568km (235km with wax)
• Replace Levo rear brake pad after 1245km (previous was 1184km). • Wend Wax PG-1130 Chain after 350km with Paraffin wax. Chain is now 920km old.
Retire SRAM PG-1130 chain after 1394 km.

Avoiding smoky air from multiple fires, including at Big Basin.
Ear infections in both ears this week. And develop left eye infection.
Working on getting house prep'd for sale.
Packing all week long to get house ready for showing
TOTAL 2020 Moving time: 416 hours Elevation: 151,000 metres Distance: 7187.1
